text: Judeo-Aramaic is a dialect of Aramaic, which was spoken by many Jews in the Second Temple period from 587 BC to 70 AD, and for a few centuries afterwards. * * * * * ==Significance== There is a common belief that Judeo-Aramaic was the mother tongue of Jesus, which was influenced by Hebrew. ==Related pages== * Yiddish * History of Jews * Ladino language * Hebrew language * Aramaic language * Judeo-Arabic dialects ==References== Category:Judaism Category:Jewish people Category:Jewish culture Category:Semitic languages
title: Judeo-Aramaic languages
